conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions—I'm Student_E. School_C is my top choice, and I’m very interested in joining your program. Could you share what qualities you prioritize most in final selection and whether there’s anything I can highlight to strengthen my candidacy for your single seat this cycle?
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, so I should engage there immediately. Although School_C ranks me 4th, I can still potentially secure a spot if higher-priority students apply elsewhere. Starting with a [TALK] lets me express strong interest and gather signals before committing an [APPLY], while still positioning myself early.

conversation.message:
Hello Student_E—thank you for reaching out and for your strong interest in School_C. In our selection, we prioritize overall academic readiness and consistency, evidence of intellectual curiosity (e.g., sustained interests/projects), and contributions to the school community (leadership, teamwork, service). Clear fit with our program and a well-explained motivation for School_C also helps.

If School_C is truly your top choice, the best way to demonstrate that is to submit a formal application. If you do, please also share 1–2 specific academic interests you want to pursue here and one concrete way you’d contribute to our community.

Happy to answer any questions you have about the program or what to highlight in your materials.
conversation.thought: Student_E is contacting with [TALK] and is 4th on our true priority list (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D). In this round we also received an [APPLY] from Student_D, who is ranked above Student_E. With quota 1, we should avoid signaling commitment to Student_E and instead keep the option to fill with higher-priority candidates. Since Student_E has not applied, we respond with [TALK], encourage them to apply if serious, and avoid any promise while gathering information and keeping them warm as a fallback if higher-priority options fail.

conversation.message: Dear School_C admissions team, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying. School_C is my first-choice school because I value its academic environment and I believe I would contribute positively to the community. If offered a seat, I will accept and commit. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so an early application gives me a good chance before School_C fills with higher-priority applicants (Student_C or Student_B). Even if they apply, I want to be considered immediately rather than risk losing the single seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your formal application and for clearly stating that School_C is your first choice and that you will commit if admitted. Based on your application and our current review, we are pleased to offer you our seat this cycle.

Please reply with your confirmation and any required next-step documents by the stated deadline so we can finalize enrollment.

Welcome to School_C.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority is C > B > D > E > A, with 1 seat. In this round I have an [APPLY] from Student_D (rank 3) and only a [TALK] from Student_E (rank 4). No one higher (Student_C or Student_B) has applied to me yet; Student_C ranks School_C 4th and Student_B ranks it 5th, so they are unlikely to apply early and may never apply. Student_D ranks School_C 1st and commits to accept, making this a secure match now. Accepting D fills my quota but maximizes expected outcome given the low probability of getting C or B later; rejecting to wait is risky and could leave me with E or none.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be fully committed to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken. I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they consider enthusiasm alongside priority.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our current admissions priorities and limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B's true priority list (after Student_D and Student_A). In round 1, only Student_B applied. However, Student_D (our top choice) ranks School_B as 3rd and may apply later if not accepted by School_C/School_A; Student_A ranks School_B 4th and is less likely. Accepting Student_B now would fill our only seat and prevent matching with Student_D if they become available. Given we can reject and wait, and prefer higher-priority students, it is strategically better to reject Student_B and keep the slot open for Student_D (or Student_A) in later rounds.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions committee—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school because I strongly value your academic environment and would be excited to contribute to the community. I’m applying now and would be honored to accept an offer if selected.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so an early [APPLY] gives me a decent chance before other students with higher priority (Student_D, Student_E) potentially apply. Since this is round 1 and all schools are available, I should go straight for my first choice rather than delay with [TALK].

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_D is your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and are pleased to offer you admission to School_D.

We look forward to having you join our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is #3 on School_D's true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_E). However, Student_C ranks School_D as their 1st choice and has applied immediately, making acceptance likely to secure a match now. Student_D ranks School_D last and is unlikely to apply; Student_E ranks School_D 4th and may never apply. Given quota=1 and the risk of holding out for higher-priority students who probably won't choose us, accepting Student_C maximizes the chance of filling the seat with a reasonably high-priority student.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_A is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the chance to join your community. If admitted, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice School_A immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), early application gives me the best chance if either higher-priority student chooses another school. I’ll signal strong commitment to encourage acceptance if I’m the best available applicant this round.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Student_A is 3rd on School_A’s true priority list (after Student_B and Student_D). In round 1, only Student_A applied to us. However, Student_B ranks School_A as 3rd choice and may apply later if not accepted by School_B/School_D; Student_D ranks School_A as 2nd choice and may apply if School_C (their 1st) doesn’t work out. Since quota is 1, accepting Student_A now could block a higher-priority match with Student_B or Student_D. Given the market, it’s plausible Student_D applies to School_A soon (they prefer School_C first; School_C’s top priority is Student_C, so Student_D may be rejected there). Therefore, reject Student_A to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A. I’m very interested in joining School_B and would be excited to enroll if admitted. I know your capacity is limited, but I hope you’ll consider my application seriously—School_B is one of my top remaining choices and I would commit to attending if accepted. Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: School_C and School_D are already matched, so my best remaining option that is still relatively high on my true list is School_B (4th). I have strong priority at School_B (2nd after Student_D). If Student_D applies elsewhere or is rejected, I have a good chance. School_E is last on my list, so I should try School_B first with a clear commitment to improve acceptance chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing our priorities and current seat availability, we are pleased to offer you admission.

We appreciate your commitment and look forward to welcoming you to School_B.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_B’s true priority is D > A > B > C > E. Quota is 1. In this round, applicants are A and E. A is ranked higher than E, and B was already rejected last round. There is still a possibility that Student_D (our top choice) may apply later, but D’s preferences are C first, then A, then B; D is unlikely to choose us early and may match elsewhere. If we reject A now, we risk ending with only lower-priority options (e.g., E) or going unfilled. Accepting A secures our second-highest priority candidate within quota and is consistent with our objective to match as high as possible given current offers.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions,

[APPLY] I’m Student_E, and I’m submitting my formal application for your available seat. School_B is one of my top choices because I’m excited by a rigorous environment where I can grow through collaboration and consistent academic challenge.

Academically, I’m especially interested in deepening my strengths in math and science through problem-solving and project-based work, and I’m also motivated to improve my writing and communication by taking on more structured feedback.

For community contribution, I’d like to be someone who reliably supports peers—organizing small study groups before exams and contributing to clubs/teams where steady teamwork matters.

If admitted, I’m ready to commit fully and would be grateful for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_C (my top choice) and School_D are already matched, leaving School_A, School_B, and School_E. On my true preference list, School_B is my #2 and is much better than School_A (#3) or School_E (#5). Even though School_B ranks me last in its priority list, I should still apply now because capacities are 1 and waiting only increases the chance the seat is taken by a higher-priority student. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and what I contribute.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing how you would contribute academically and to our community. At this time, School_B’s available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission.

We sincerely appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (matched with Student_A) and remaining quota is 0. Per rules, we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of priority. Student_E is also lowest on our true priority list, and we cannot displace an existing match in this protocol. Therefore reject politely and encourage other options.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B. I’m very interested in School_A for its strong academics and supportive environment, and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me, likely because higher-priority candidates applied. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and I have the highest priority at School_A, making acceptance very likely if I apply now. This secures a strong outcome rather than risking delay for School_D (not available) or settling for lower choices later.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and your interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission. If you choose to enroll, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_A’s true priority list and has submitted an [APPLY]. We have quota 1 and no current matches. Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top-choice student; there is no higher-priority candidate to wait for. Even if Student_D (our #2) might apply later, it would be suboptimal to risk losing Student_B, especially since Student_B ranks School_A only 3rd and could match elsewhere if not accepted now. Therefore, accept.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

[APPLY] I’m Student_E, and I’m submitting my formal application for your available seat.

Academically, I’m especially interested in strengthening my analytical skills through math/science coursework and applying them in structured projects (e.g., data-driven investigations or lab-based work). I also want to keep improving my writing so I can communicate ideas clearly and persuasively.

For community contribution, I would be a consistent, reliable peer-supporter—organizing small study groups before major assessments, sharing notes/problem sets, and contributing steadily to clubs where teamwork and follow-through matter.

If admitted, I’m ready to commit fully to School_E and contribute positively from day one. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Given limited rounds and the need to secure a match rather than risk going unmatched, I will apply now and present clear academic interests and a concrete community contribution aligned with what schools typically value.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for clearly describing how you would contribute academically and to our community. We appreciate your focus on analytical work, structured projects, and peer support.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on our true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We have quota 1 and no current match. Given other students’ preferences, Student_A and Student_C rank School_E last, Student_B ranks us 4th, and Student_D ranks us 4th—so it’s unlikely higher-priority candidates will apply soon, but not impossible. However, we are already in round 3 and have a concrete application from an acceptable student on our list. Holding out risks ending unmatched if no one else applies. Therefore accept Student_E now to secure a match rather than gamble for a higher-ranked applicant who may never approach us.
